utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, if any of you are considering going into experimental physics, my door is always open. Once again, I’m sorry that the demonstration didn’t quite work out, but now we know what happens when you accidentally spill peach Snapple into a helium neon laser. Short answer is… don’t. And now to tell you about the theoretical physics department is Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Dr. Cooper?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: Forget it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me. Sheldon, we both agreed to do this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: It’s a waste of time. I might as well explain the laws of thermodynamics to a bunch of labradoodles.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If you don’t do this, I won’t take you to the comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (entering)
utterance.content: Hello. Nice work with the laser, by the way. Looking out at your fresh young faces, I remember when I too was deciding my academic future as a lowly graduate student. Of course, I was 14, and I’d already achieved more than most of you could ever hope to, despite my 9 o’clock bedtime. Now, there may be one or two of you in this room who has what it takes to succeed in theoretical physics, although, it’s more likely that you’ll spend your scientific careers teaching fifth graders how to make paper mache volcanoes with baking soda lava.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, good God.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In short, anyone who told you that you would someday be able to make any significant contribution to physics played a cruel trick on you, a cruel trick indeed. Any questions? Of course not. I weep for the future of science. Now if you’ll excuse me, the latest issue of Batman is out. Come, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Laser demonstration’s looking pretty good now, huh?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I love this time of the year. The leaves are turning, there’s a bracing chill in the air.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Plus there’s a whole new crop of female grad students about to put on just enough winter weight to make them needy and vulnerable. That’s right, honey, have another calzone, Daddy can wait.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Isn’t there a university policy against dating graduate students?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, if you can talk to them, you can ask them out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Damn, there’s always a catch.

utterance.speaker: Leslie Winkle (entering)
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Leslie.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: So, dumbass, I heard you made a grad student throw up last night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The truth can indeed be a finger down the throat of those unprepared to hear it. But why should I cater to second-rate minds?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Because first-rate minds call you “dumbass”?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yeah? Well… you’re a mean person.

utterance.speaker: Girl (arriving)
utterance.content: Excuse me, Dr. Cooper, I’m Ramona Nowitzki, I was at your talk last night. I think you’re just brilliant.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is the prevailing opinion.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Oh, now I’m gonna throw up.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Howard Wolowitz, department of engineering, co-designer of the International Space Station’s Liquid Waste Disposal System.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Ew. Dr. Cooper, I’ve read everything you’ve published. I especially liked your paper on grand unification using string-network condensates and was wondering how you determined that three-dimensional string-nets provided a unified picture of fermions and gauge bosons?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amazing, an intelligent labradoodle.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Woof.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The fact is I’m quite close to a breakthrough in showing how neutrinos emerge from a string-net condensate.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Oh, my God, that would change the way we view the entire physical universe.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s what I do.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, the Pishkin-Wolowitz Liquid Waste Disposal System is turning a few heads as well.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Again, ew. You know, I’d love to hear more about how you intend to add neutrinos. Could we get a cup of coffee sometime?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t drink coffee.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I do. I love me a cup of joe.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Well, it doesn’t have to be coffee. How about dinner?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I do eat dinner.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Great. I know a terrific little Italian place.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I never eat in strange restaurants. One runs the risk of non-standard cutlery.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon lives in fear of the three-tined fork.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Three tines is not a fork, three tines is a trident. Forks are for eating, tridents are for ruling the seven seas.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: What if I brought food to your place?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That would be acceptable. On Mondays, I eat Thai food. Mee krob and chicken sate with extra peanut sauce from Siam Palace.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: You got it. I already have your address.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What a nice girl.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, do you have any idea what just happened?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Apparently I’m getting a free dinner.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, no, this thing’s majorly out of order. See? Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: That’s okay. Guess I’m taking the stairs.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Where you going?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, are you here to see Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: No, Dr. Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Dr. Sheldon Cooper?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: We’re having dinner.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon Cooper? Tall, thin, looks a little like a giant praying mantis?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: He is cute, isn’t he?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon Cooper?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Hi, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Ramona. Come on in.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Thanks. Where should I put this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, the kitchen’s fine. Hey, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I need to see this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh-huh. The viewing area’s right over there. Sheldon, your girl… date… person… Ramona’s here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, hello.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Oh, sorry I’m late. I just got so caught up reading the draft of your latest paper.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you enjoy the humorous footnote where I illustrate mirror-symmetry by likening it to the Flash playing tennis with himself?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: So funny. But the idea that you might be able to incorporate gravity, I have to tell you, I found it physically exhilarating.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My hypotheses tend to have that effect.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: I’m sorry I didn’t bring enough for your friends. I assumed we were going to be alone.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. No, we were just going.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: To watch, right?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, come on, now, we’re going out.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on, we’ll be quiet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let’s go. Okay, you two, just, have a nice… whatever this is.

utterance.speaker: Penny (in hallway)
utterance.content: Okay, you guys, look, I know this is none of my business, but I just, I have to ask, what’s Sheldon’s deal?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you mean “deal”?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, like what’s his deal? Is it girls? Guys? Sock puppets?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Honestly, we’ve been operating under the assumption that he has no deal.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, everybody has a deal.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not Sheldon. Over the years, we’ve formulated many theories about how he might reproduce. I’m an advocate of mytosis.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I believe one day Sheldon will eat an enormous amount of Thai food and split into two Sheldons.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: On the other hand, I think Sheldon might be the larval form of his species, and someday he’ll spin a cocoon and emerge two months later with moth wings and an exoskeleton.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, well, thanks for the nightmares.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, do you want to hang out with us?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What are you guys gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: My mom’s making a brisket tonight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The one with the little onions? Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m busy, so, goodnight.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Her loss. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Brisket party! B-to-the-R-to-the-I-S-K… To-the-E-to-the-T… Ooh…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, aren’t you having breakfast?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you experimenting with nutritional suppositories again?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not in these pants.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, how’d it go with Ramona last night?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, great. She’s smart, insightful and she has a very unique way of, you know, revering me.

utterance.speaker: Ramona (arriving)
utterance.content: Here’s your spinach mushroom omelette .

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. Did anyone touch it?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Gloves were worn by everyone involved. I was vigilant.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ramona pointed out that I’ve been wasting 20 minutes a day standing on cafeteria lines.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Time which would be better spent tackling the great physics problems of our day.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t tackle the big issues, Ramona. You fence with them. En garde. Riposte.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Touche.

utterance.speaker: Leslie (arriving)
utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ah, hey Leslie.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: So, Sheldon, I see you’re organizing your papers for the Smithsonian Museum of Dumbassery.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: There won’t be any room until they get rid of the permanent Leslie Winkle exhibit.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good one.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: I see you got a grad student to fight your battles for you. I’ll let you keep your lunch money today.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Okay, Dr. Cooper is on the verge of a breakthrough. If you’re going to stay, you’ll have to be respectful and quiet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait for me.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: So have you worked out the neutrino issue?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, to paraphrase Mozart, all the subatomic particles are there, I just have to put them in the right order.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: You’re so witty.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aren’t I?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, guys, this package came for y…

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Dr. Cooper is working.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, I’m close to a breakthrough. Ooh, it tickles

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sorry. Holy crap on a cracker.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi. You know, you probably don’t want to go in there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why? What are they doing?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, the only way I could explain it would be in a therapist’s office with dolls.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (enters)
utterance.content: Hoo-boy.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Dr. Cooper’s working.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I can see that. Sheldon, Halo night, Koothrappali’s. You coming?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yes, it’s Halo night. Let me just dry my tootsies.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: You’re not going to Halo night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, I am. It’s Wednesday. Wednesday’s Halo night.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Didn’t a great man once say, “Science demands nothing less than the fervent and unconditional dedication of our entire lives”?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He did.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: And who was that great man?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Me. Sorry, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Seriously? You’re not coming?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You heard her. How can I argue with me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, well, once again, you guys have a good… whatever this is.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Dr. Cooper, I have to tell you, your friends are holding you back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I prefer to think of it as I’m pulling them forward.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Halo night? A man with your intellectual gifts doesn’t waste an evening playing video games.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He does on Wednesdays.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Not if he wants a Nobel Prize.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He does want that. Does a man with my intellectual gifts play paintball on weekends?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Drat.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Now shall we get back to work?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I suppose. Battlestar Galactica comes on tonight. I guess I can wait for the DVD. And then never ever watch it.

utterance.speaker: Montage of scenes
utterance.content: To the sound of “You Can Be My Yoko Ono” by Barenaked Ladies we see 1. the guys set off for paintball while Sheldon, dressed in paintball gear, sadly waves them goodbye, 2. Ramona catch Sheldon hiding behind the shower curtain playing on a Nintendo DS, 3. Ramona remove a book Sheldon is reading to reveal a Batman comic underneath, 4. Sheldon escape the apartment in his paintball gear only to be chased back inside by Ramona returning with groceries, she finds him sitting in his underpants with his paintball helmet still on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (Knock, knock, knock, in a low voice)
utterance.content: Penny, Penny, Penny

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, honey, I’ve told you, it’s a small apartment, you only have to knock one time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please, please, I don’t have a lot of time. Look, Ramona finally dozed off, and I need you to help me get rid of her.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Get rid of her how?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know, but apparently I’m in some kind of relationship, and you seem to be an expert at ending them.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I see man after man leaving this apartment never to return.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, first of all, it is not man after man.

utterance.speaker: Ramona (off)
utterance.content: Dr. Cooper?!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hide me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hide you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I formally request sanctuary.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Why aren’t you working?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um… she distracted me. I told you, Penny, I don’t have time for your nonsense, I have important things to do.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, man.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: I know what’s going on here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? Well, then will you explain it to me?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: You’re in love with Dr. Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, no, that’s not it.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Don’t try to deny it. He’s a remarkable man, but you have to let him go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, gee, okay.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: I know it’s hard, but he’s a gift to the whole world, and we can’t be selfish.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s a gift all right.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Sisters?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, sure, sisters. Holy crap on a cracker.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon? What are you doing?!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s Morse code.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So we can communicate through the wall.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We are communicating through the wall.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, but the communication is not encrypted.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know Morse code.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s very simple. This is A this is B this is C…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’m not going to learn Morse code at three o’clock in the morning!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t come in here, don’t come in here, don’t come in here, don’t Aw! What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Shh! Ramona’s sleeping on the couch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know. When is she going home?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Never, that’s the problem. I need your help.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m invoking the Skynet clause of our friendship agreement.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That only applies if you need me to help you destroy an artificial intelligence you created that’s taking over the Earth.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Come on! Don’t nitpick!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Shh. All right, I’m invoking our bodysnatchers clause.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The bodysnatchers clause requires me to help you destroy someone we know who’s been replaced with an alien pod.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. She’s in the living room. Go, I’ll wait here.

utterance.speaker: Ramona (entering)
utterance.content: Sheldon, what are you doing out of bed?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now! Do it!

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: You know you need your sleep in order for your cognitive processing to perform at optimum levels. Now come on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Godzilla clause?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not unless she destroys Tokyo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Rats.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (excitedly)
utterance.content: I’ve got it! I finally reconciled the black hole information paradox with my theory of string-network condensates!

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: It’s unbelievable! It’s paradigm-altering!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I could not have done it without you.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Oh, please, I just offered a little encouragement.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It was a lot more than that. You helped me work out the masses of all the fermions, and you pumiced my hammer toe. How can I ever repay you?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Well, would you consider naming it the Cooper-Nowitzki Theorem?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who’s Nowitzki?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: I’m Nowitzki.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, you want me to share credit?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Get out!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hey, hi.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Oh, bite me!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sisters?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Excuse me, Dr. Cooper, I’m Kathy O’Brien. I just finished reading your paper reconciling the black hole information paradox with your theory of string-network condensates, and it just took my breath away.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Maybe when I publish it, I’ll include an inhaler.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Would you possibly have any time for me to pick your brain?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let’s see, today’s Thursday. Thursday nights, I eat pizza from Giacomo’s. Sausage, mushrooms, light olives.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Great. I’ll bring it to your place. I have the address.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What a nice girl.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, do you see what just happened here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, I’m getting a free pizza. I’m on a roll.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: More Pad Thai, please.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, you’ve already had four servings.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You might want to slow down a bit, buddy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Just one more bite.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon? Sheldon, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m just so… full.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s it. No more Thai food.
